qas.question: Who came up with a policy for indigenous autonomy?
When did Morales launch his policy in the eastern lowlands?
What was Bolivia the first country in the history of South America to do?

answers.text: affirm the right of indigenous people to govern themselves

qas.question: What did the President vow he would never betray?
What effect has the issue of indigenous autonomy had on Bolivia?

context: <a0_0>Morales<a0_0/> began work on his "indigenous autonomy" policy, which he launched in the eastern lowlands department on August 3, <a1_0>2009<a1_0/>, making Bolivia the first country in the history of South America to <a2_0>affirm the right of indigenous people to govern themselves<a2_0/>. Speaking in Santa Cruz Department, the President called it "a historic day for the peasant and indigenous movement", saying that, though he might make errors, he would "never betray the <a3_0>fight<a3_0/> started by our ancestors and the fight of the Bolivian people". A vote on further autonomy will take place in referendums which are expected to be held in December 2009. The issue has <a4_0>divided<a4_0/> the country.
